medical_history.chief_complaint: Increasing depression, sleepiness, loss of interest and energy, decreased ability to concentrate, and memory lapses.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Depression developed gradually over several months. The patient continued to work full-time until about five days before hospitalization when she became withdrawn, lying on her bed for hours and neglecting personal hygiene. After being prescribed amitriptyline, she started to sleep up to 17 hours a day.
medical_history.family_history: Father had Alzheimer's disease and was paranoid; mother died of cancer when the patient was 10 years old.
medical_history.social_history: The patient mentioned needing a vacation in California and expressed a desire to stop working and have a baby.
